author.cite: It's not how you react when things go well, but when things go wrong, because ultimately things will go wrong.

author.name: Epictetus
author.cite: Don’t seek for everything to happen as you wish it would, but rather wish that everything happens as it actually will — then your life will flow well.
There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.

author.name: Marcus Aurelius
author.cite: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

author.name: Zeno of Citium
author.cite: Wellbeing is attained by little and little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself.

author.name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
author.cite: This is our big mistake: to think we look forward to death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death.
